Blog.post: I dunno. Sometimes I just think I'm doing too many things at once... But I'll give it a try for a few days...
Slaving away at university at a stupid programme to save some stuff to disk. Sucks. And I wanna see football (soccer!?) instead. But there's still hours to go.

That keeper really saved us there. And Sweden takes the prize for the 2 nicest goals in the Euro championships so far... In other news, I got an e-mail from the university of Oslo telling I've been accepted for the fall semester. Made me a bit speechless but very happy!
Lo and behold, this is sortof a test blog from my new gmail account. Very cool, now I'm just waiting for messages to drop in...

Fair enough. Sweden's game was better :) I'm actually getting a football fever worked up here... that's all good in preparation of watching the Sweden-Denmark game at work in Copenhagen tomorrow. And I downloaded a load of pic's from my digicam today. Now all I need is a bigger disk to put'em on the web.
France beat England, and Sweden really beat Bulgaria. I like. Henke is a national hero, even though he's from Helsingborg.

I voted on in the EU elections thursday to get that done. On friday I went to Oslo, and partied two nights in a row. That was nice, but the Airport train in Oslo broke down and I was a full two hours late. What a nightmare. I even considered setting the train on fire: then, at least, the fire brigade would've gotten us out. The weekend was superb, though!

...and that's good, because for now that means the end of the week (not for long though, because I will be working weekends soon). It also means I get tp go to Oslo. That's very good. 2 parties lined up, but that's not the best part :-)
...and that gmail and SkypeOut would want me to test their stuff. Well, I'll just wait and see. Got my login data from SEB in Denmark. Seems their system sucks...

7 hours at work, 3 hours of commute and another 3 hours in the computing lab. I'm toast, but not sure I can sleep. But I got 2 answers I'd been waiting for today: one from my brand-new danish bank and one from the Commission (see yesterday's blog). Still waiting for news from the university of Oslo, though. I had some Knake (typical Lundian sausage) and a dirt cheap Danish beer for dinner. The sausage was the better part...
Ah yeah, I checked out the web site of the urlLink Euro Ombudsman today to see if the Commission needs to answer me regarding student involvement and Erasmus Mundus. Turns out they do!

Argl. Getting up at six is no fun... but work was OK today, we got to play with a car. The other job sucks; I hate calling people when they haven't asked for it. And it's way past bedtime. But I got a nice press release today on urlLink AFP and I made some dough I never baked off: fresh buns tomorrow for breakfast. I also washed and the drying stand fills up my whole bathroom.

Just booked a flight to Norway and back with urlLink Sterling . Actually, I made a mistake and booked for the wrong day; however I realised this in time and they let me change the reservation at no extra charge. That's cool, and it ain't what urlLink Volare did that time I wanted to fly to Palermo but accidentally booked to Naples instead.
Got up at six to ride the train to work in Copenhagen. Left at four - and presto! a call from that other job. And was at school until ten programming away at a stupid news server in C++
